intro: Apsanthea serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering pincushion cactus, is a species native to southern Africa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cactaceae, characterized by its succulent stems and spines. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom late in the growing season. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
